Ses01F_impro06_F008  SO I WAS LOOKING AT THIS OTHER ONE AND THERE WAS LIKE A PIECE OF CANDY THERE AND I THOUGHT THAT I WOULD TAKE THE CANDY AND PUT IT ON HER HEADSTONE AND
Ses01F_impro06_F009  THIS WOMAN CAME UP AND IT WAS HERS IT WAS HER PERSON THAT WAS THERE
Ses01F_impro06_F010  YEAH  AND SHE  SHE WAS LIKE THAT PATHETIC I HOPE YOU ENJOY
Ses01F_impro06_F011  AND I  YOU KNOW  I MEAN  I SAID I WAS SORRY AND I BROUGHT IT BACK TO HER  KIND OF  AND I PUT IT ON THE GROUND AND SHE WAS LIKE  YOU KNOW  IT'S FINE I  SHE'S LIKE  I'D RATHER HAVE HER BACK HONESTLY
Ses01F_impro06_F012  I DON'T KNOW  IT'S JUST LIKE I FELT SO BAD BECAUSE I SHOULDN'T HAVE DONE IT I DON'T KNOW  WHATEVER
Ses01F_impro06_F013  I DON'T KNOW

Ses01F_impro06_F015  COVER HOURS
Ses01F_impro06_F016  I BROUGHT  I BROUGHT YOU UP WITH ME WE WENT TO RELENT  YEAH  FOR THE DAY WE RAN THROUGH THE SPRINKLERS
Ses01F_impro06_F018  YEAH  IT'S HUGE AND  REDLANDS IS AN OLD CITY SO THERE'S LOTS OF MATISTAS
Ses01F_impro06_F019  YEAH
Ses01F_impro06_F020  IT'S WEIRD WHENEVER I GO BACK TO TOWN  I THINK OF HER I MEAN  IT'S LIKE  IT REALLY GREW UP TOGETHER AND SHE DIED WHEN WE WERE 21 AND YEAH  SHE HAD CANCER  SHE HAD TWO BRAIN TUMORS
Ses01F_impro06_F021  MY BEST FRIEND HEATHER SHE'S GOT IT WE HAVE A WE BUILT THIS LIKE LITTLE THERE'S A PARK PROSPECT PARKING THERE'S LIKE A GARDEN SECTION OF IT THAT WE SET UP FOR HER
Ses01F_impro06_F022  SHE'S HAVE THESE POETRY PARTIES I'M IN MEMORIAL DAY
Ses01F_impro06_F023  UM  YEAH
Ses01F_impro06_F024  AND THE LAST ONE BEFORE SHE DIED  I REMEMBER SHE COULDN'T REALLY STAND
Ses01F_impro06_F025  BUT I MEAN SHE COULD BUT IT WAS SO I WAS KIND OF SITTING IN HER FEET LIKE HOLDING HER UP AND SHE HAD THESE POEMS SHE HAD MEMORIZED AND I REMEMBER LOOKING UP SHE HAD CURLY RED HAIR AND THERE WAS THIS PALM TREE RIGHT BEHIND HER AND IT'S LIKE IT WAS LIKE IT WAS CROWN YOU KNOW GROWING UP HER HEAD IS COOL
Ses01F_impro06_F026  SO  MY GUESS SHE  SHE MEMORIES THIS ONE JOHN DUNN  IT'S CALLED DEATH BE NOT PROUD
Ses01F_impro06_F027  THERE'S ANOTHER ONE I CAN'T REMEMBER
Ses01F_impro06_F028  I REMEMBER TOO WHEN WE WERE  SHE DIED AT UCLA SHE WAS  SHE BRINGS HER DREAM AND THERE WASN'T MUCH HOPE TO BE AGAIN  BUT I GAVE BLOOD FOR HER SURGERY AT HER MOM AND I BEFORE SO WE DROPPED OFF IN A WAITING ROOM AND THEN WE WERE GIVING BLOOD AND CAME BACK AND SHE  IN HER WHEELCHAIR  LIKE  CAN HARDLY DO ANYTHING  RECITING HER POETRY FOR THESE PEOPLE  LIKE IN THE WAITING ROOM ALL SHE NEEDS IS THE GODDAMN AUDIENCE  YOU KNOW
